Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About LB & Partners




LB partners is specialized in improving the EBIT of equipment manufacturers by optimizing the price and margins of drawing spare parts.




LB partners acts on behalf of major companies as part of their corporate value growth plans, driven by management and shareholders.




LB partners offers to companies its expertise, methods and technological process in order to optimize the sales of drawing parts according to three aspects:

A consistent pricing with the perceived value of the service provided to customers,
An optimization of margins in line with the company's added value
A customized technological process that guarantees the sustainability of the gains realized.




Join LB partners for a human and technological experience on key strategic projects with fantastic teams and customers.




Mission and responsibilities 




On a given set of Customer, the data analyst mission is to:

Analyze and optimize Customer spare part data (weight, composition, prices, segmentation etc.)
Develop and implement effective pricing rules and parameters.
Monitor and enhance the performance of our programs in terms of EBIT growth, pricing consistency, and customer satisfaction.
Engage actively in customer workshops, contributing to mutual success.




The Analyst is contributing to the continuous improvement of the practice by:

Propose and share with LB partners teams some new methodologies or tools
Improve internal processes
Answer Customer needs and interest with practical solutions (KPIs, metrics, follow-up, …)




Experience & skills 




Required :

A degree in Economics, Management, or Engineering (HES/Bac+3/5).
1-3 years of relevant experience in similar industries (equipment industry, data & statistic industry, …)
Agile with data in XLS and communication tools (Powerpoint…)
Fluent in written and spoken English and French




Desired :

Familiarity with ERP systems like SAP or Oracle.
Experience with BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau.




Profile & leadership




Required :

Analytical mindset : agile and structured in handling numbers and data
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Team player and good interpersonal skills
Curious and innovative, always seeking new solutions.
Result driven




Desired

Autonomy in operations
Strong influencing skills.




Contract details




A permanent contract with 5 weeks of annual leave.
Flexible working options with up to 2 days of remote work per week.
Occasional business trip (on average 2-3 days per month, mostly in Switzerland)
Offices located in Lausanne

Title: Data analyst RH (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Ressources Humaines, nous recherchons un Data analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la création de rapports, la modélisation de données et la mise en place de solutions analytiques pour soutenir les prises de décision stratégiques.

Aider dans l’élaboration et la mise en place de la feuille de route du reporting RH

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
  • Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Data Business Analyst
Description:
Tisseur de liens, créateur de tendances et porteur d’influence depuis plus de 20 ans en Suisse, nous avons l’ambition de devenir le 1er retailleur du pays sur le marché online de la maison.







Vous êtes tenté(e) par de nouveaux défis dans une entreprise au fort potentiel de croissance ? Vous avez envie de grandir professionnellement dans une société qui fait toute sa place à l’humain et à la proactivité ?







Rejoignez un acteur majeur du e-commerce dans le secteur de la mode et de la maison. La Redoute Suisse, filiale d’un groupe français, bénéficie des avantages d’un grand groupe (forte dimension internationale, possibilité d’évolution) et d’une PME (autonomie, confiance managériale).







Pour notre filiale basée en Suisse, à Montreux, au sein de notre département IT-Data nous recherchons un(e) :







Data Business Analyst à 100%







VOS MISSIONS




Véritable business partenaire, ses clients sont transverses et ses partenaires principaux sont l’IT, la finance, la logistique, le marketing produit et la relation client.




Il identifie les besoins en data de la filiale selon les axes d’analyses formulés par le plan stratégique de l’entreprise et les besoins des business partners.




Via des extractions ad hoc, il aide à mettre en place des analyses permettant d’optimiser des processus métier et de faciliter la prise de décision.




Dans le cadre du plan de transformation de l’entreprise, il accompagne les équipes projets à cadrer les besoins, comprendre les enjeux et en mesurer la performance




Dans ce sens, il met à disposition des utilisateurs et business partners des data fiables sous la forme de tables, modèle de données, tableaux et bord et reporting (Excel, Power BI, Power Query…).




Il est garant du maintien, de la véracité et de la mise à jour des reporting existants.




Il met à disposition des équipes marketing et de contrôle de gestion les données et outils nécessaires à la construction du budget et des forecast.










VOTRE PROFIL




Formation équivalent Master en statistique / économétrie, master spécialisé Big data ou bien en HEG/HEC avec une spécialisation data science / analytics
Expérience souhaitée de 2 ans minimum sur un poste similaire.
Orientation et sensibilité business forte afin de comprendre les enjeux de l’entreprise
Parfaites connaissances en langages SQL standard, DAX, Power Query et de l’environnement Power BI (éventuellement Python)
Parle couramment Français et Anglais
Sens de l’organisation, capable de gérer plusieurs projets en même temps
Curiosité, dynamisme et esprit d’équipe










NOTRE ENTREPRISE







La Redoute est certifiée Great Place to Work et fut élue 5ème Small Best Workplace en Suisse en 2022 et 2023. La bonne ambiance, l’entre-aide et le cadre de travail sont des atouts reconnus par l’ensemble de nos collaborateurs.




A deux pas de la gare de Montreux et face au lac, la Redoute est idéalement placée et les locaux sont chaleureux et agréables.




Au-delà des nombreuses prestations sociales et avantages collaborateurs, nous tenons à ce que nos collaborateurs conservent un bon équilibre vie privée, vie professionnelle en proposant des heures de travail flexibles, récupérables et en bénéficiant de 2 jours de télétravail par semaine.




Vous vous êtes reconnu dans cette annonce et même si vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases, n’hésitez pas à nous adresser votre dossier de candidature complet, car vous êtes peut-être la personne que nous recherchons.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing and Digital Sales
Description:
Job Reference #
299146BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Do you have a passion for data and are excited about the opportunity to apply and further develop your know-how in dynamic and agile marketing organization? Do you have profound knowledge of databases (SQL)? Are you familiar with visualization tools and do you know how to prepare, provide, and analyze data to enable data-driven decisions?

We’re looking for a data analyst to:


build and establish the business and sales data foundation (e.g. data sources, data clean up, data warehouse)
develop concepts, validate data, execute analytics projects for marketing and digital sales to answer key strategic questions
analyze business needs and provide data-driven recommendations (timing, product push, journey) to increase conversion / MROI
enable and support the organization for data-driven decision-making and in the identification of growth opportunities
act as an internal account manager by developing close ties with internal key stakeholders and offering proactive support in the area of marketing and business intelligence
work on the interface of business, sales, marketing and market research data and connect different data sources for increased MROI
be the ambassador and enable the organization through education and lead the transformation (i.e., into the AI age)


Your team
You will be part of the Client Intelligence & Market Research team within Marketing and Digital Sales.

We deal with all client & market research activities for UBS Switzerland like exploration of client and sales data, measuring and continuous monitoring of client satisfaction as well as brand and marketing activities to identify improvement potentials within UBS Switzerland. You will work alongside a supportive team of experts who are passionate about leveraging data to identify growth opportunities and enhance client experiences.

Your expertise


Master’s degree in marketing and communication sciences or advanced studies in analytics
3+ years proven experience in a business intelligence role, including a track record in building BI architecture
expertise in data modeling, data warehouse design and data integration
proficiency in data visualization with Power BI
experience in SQL and Python (familiarity with frameworks/ tools like DBT, Pandas, etc. or willingness to learn)
strong business acumen with the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions
can-do attitude and a very open and engaging personality with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g., Digital Marketing)
fluent in English and sound command of German


About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich?


Du entwirfst und implementierst Datenpipelines für die Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datensätze.
Du arbeitest mit modernen Cloud-Technologien, insbesondere mit Azure-Diensten, um skalierbare und effiziente Datenlösungen zu entwickeln.
Mitwirken bei der Migration von On-Premises-SAP-Systemen (BW/BO) in die Cloud
Du nutzt Data Engineering Best Practices, um Datenmodelle, ETL-Prozesse und Datenarchitekturen zu entwerfen.
Du entwickelst und wartest Data Lakes und Datenbanken, um eine optimale Datenverfügbarkeit und -qualität sicherzustellen.
Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python, PySpark und SQL von Vorteil
Du bist verantwortlich für die (Weiter-)Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer Datenplattform
Mitarbeit in SCRUM-organisierten Entwicklungsteams.
Du entwickelst innovative Lösungen und demonstrierst deren Machbarkeit durch Proof-of-Concepts.
Du bist Teil unserer DevOps-Kultur und förderst den Einsatz von Open-Source-Technologien.


Was erwarten wir von dir?


Du bist Teamplayer:In, der gemeinsam mit etwa 5 Kolleg:innen Ziele setzt und erreicht.
Du verfügst über >3 Jahre Erfahrung in Data Engineering oder verwandten Bereichen, vorzugsweise mit Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Azure
Starke Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung und Verwaltung von Datenpipelines, Datenmodellen und ETL-Prozessen
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, insbesondere Azure-Diensten wie Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, MLflow
Du bist erfahren im Umgang mit Big Data Technologien und Konzepten.
Motivation zur ständigen Weiterbildung in neuen Technologien und Methoden


Und was gibt's sonst noch?

Keine Rutschbahn und auch keine Bäume in den Büros, aber ein motiviertes, agiles Team freut sich auf Dich. Unsere Büros sind zentral gelegen und bieten Dir weitere attraktive Vorteile wie zum Beispiel work@travel oder flexible HomeOffice Möglichkeiten.

Bist Du bereit, die digitale Transformation mit uns zu gestalten? Bewirb Dich jetzt!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ende 1999 für eine junge und urbane Zielgruppe lanciert, hat sich die Pendlerzeitung 20 Minuten zur reichweitenstärksten Schweizer Medienmarke mit Präsenz in der Deutschschweiz, der Westschweiz und im Tessin entwickelt. News aus der Schweiz und der Welt, Unterhaltung und Inspiration: 20 Minuten erzählt Geschichten, die für Gesprächsstoff sorgen. Der Journalismus von 20 Minuten ist verlässlich, kompakt, verantwortungsvoll, neutral und kostenlos überall verfügbar. Auf den digitalen Kanälen sowie auf Social Media bietet 20 Minuten eine breite Palette multimedialer Inhalte.


Die 20 Minuten Gruppe ist Teil der TX Group und umfasst die News-Medien 20 Minuten, 20 minutes, 20 minuti und lematin.ch, das Formatradio GOAT Radio, das Lifestyle-Magazin Encore sowie die Beteiligungen im Ausland: L'essentiel in Luxemburg und Heute in Österreich.

Bist du leidenschaftlich daran interessiert, Daten zu unseren Produkten und redaktionellen Inhalten sowohl quantitativ als auch qualitativ zu analysieren, zu verstehen und zu optimieren? Wir suchen eine/n Data Analyst, der/die unser Data Team innerhalb der Technologieabteilung bei «20 Minuten» verstärkt.

Das erwartet dich:

In Zusammenarbeit mit einem Team von Produktmanagern, SEO-Experten, Entwicklern, Advertising-Spezialisten und unserer Redaktion wirst du die Nutzung von Daten mitgestalten und datengetriebene Entscheidungen im Kerngeschäft von «20 Minuten», «20 minutes», «Le Matin» und «L'Essentiel» unterstützen. Dies umfasst das Verstehen der Bedürfnisse unserer Nutzer und der Perspektive unserer Journalisten sowie die Optimierung und Verbesserung unserer Dateninfrastruktur. Deine Analysen werden dazu beitragen, unsere Angebote, digitalen Produkte und Marketingaktivitäten zu verbessern.

Das suchen wir:

Hochschulabschluss in Statistik, Data Science, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder verwandte Studiengänge

Ausgeprägte praktische Erfahrung mit Digitaldaten und Datenanalyse, insbesondere mit Google Analytics

Kenntnisse in der Nutzung von Reportingtools (z.B. Looker Studio, Power BI oder Tableau) und gute SQL-Kenntnisse (z.B. BigQuery)

Freude an der Zusammenarbeit und Abstimmung mit dem Produktteam, Entwicklern, der Redaktion und anderen relevanten Abteilungen

Leidenschaft für Medien und das Arbeiten in einem dynamischen und jungen Team

Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

Benefits:

Fünf Wochen Ferien mit Option auf sieben Wochen und Ferienkauf
Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Mobile-Office-Möglichkeiten
Bezahlter freier Tag am Geburtstag
Eine markt-, leistungs- und erfolgsorientierte Entlöhnung
Zahlreiche Vergünstigungen, z.B. Handy-Abo, Digital TV, Fahrradverleih, Autokauf
Umfassendes kostenloses Angebot im Bereich Gesundheitsförderung (Coaching, Health Coach App, Grippeschutzimpfung, diverse Trainings)
Möglichkeit für unbezahlten Urlaub bis max. sechs Monate
Zusätzliche halbe Freitage vor bestimmten Feiertagen
Mitarbeitende werben Mitarbeitende: Prämie bis CHF 2'000
Umfassendes Aus- und Weiterbildungsangebot (Führungstrainings, Mentoring, Entwicklungsprogramme, Sprachkurse, Sales Academy, Selbstkompetenz, Methodenkompetenz, Projektleitung, Change Management und vieles mehr)
Kostenlose Digital-Abonnements sowie rabattierte Print-Angebote

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Merkle, a dentsu company, powers the experience economy. For more than 35 years, the company has putpeopleat the heart of its approach to digital business transformation. As the only integrated experience consultancy in the world with a heritage in data science and business performance, Merkle delivers holistic, end-to-end experiences that drive growth, engagement, and loyalty. Merkle’s expertise has earned recognition as a “Leader” by top industry analyst firms, in categories such as digital transformation and commerce, experience design, engineering and technology integration, digital marketing, data science, CRM and loyalty, and customer data management. With more than 16,000 employees, Merkle operates in 30+ countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC.

For more information, visitwww.merkle.com.

, Job Description

We are looking for an enthusiastic Business Intelligence Consultant to join our team of Data Heroes. You will help our clients to get new insights from data, analyse and visualise their business to enable smarter decisions and better products & services delivery. Your primary focus will be in understanding business goals/KPIs, data ingestion, analysis and visualisation in cloud-based reporting tools.

You will cooperate with other data roles (architects, scientists and engineers) in the team on large international projects for the biggest world brands. You should be a versatile self-starter eager to support data-driven businesses, and also a great team player able to work within our international team with a positive, startup-minded attitude.

Here are some of the exciting tasks awaiting you:


Participation in initial workshops with client’s stakeholders to validate goals, expected inputs & deliverables
Doing initial requirements gathering, logical models, functional & technical designs
Performing data analysis of business reqs., understanding source data and map them to the target/common data model
Defining and implementing reports to visualise insights/KPIs on dashboards, using BI tools like PowerBI or Tableau
Working with data engineers to productionize data pipelines and automate reports generation & distribution


, Qualifications

A mix of the following is the person we are looking for:


Previous experience in similar BI functional role (5+ years) preferably in telco, financial or digital marketing services industry
Past experience in using BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Qlick Sense, Keboola
Solid proficiency in data warehousing concepts (ETL, Stage/Core layer, Dimensional Modelling, Data Marts etc.) and SQL programming
Experience with SQL databases, such as Oracle or MS SQL Server
Strong analytical and communication skills, data-oriented personality
Fluency in French and English


Preferred Skills:


Hands-on experience in MS Azure, AWS, Snowflake or other cloud-based environments is a big plus
Experience with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Hadoop, HBase
Proficiency in scripting languages like Python/Javascript
Understanding of big data processing using technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.
Understanding of data workflow management and ETL tools like Informatica, Pentaho, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, NiFi, StreamSets, Glue, etc.
Business expertise in areas of Digital Marketing (AdTech), Marketing Automation, CRM or e-commerce is a significant advantage


Additional Information

Why you should work with us?!


We are cooperating with an all types and sizes of clients from all around the world which allows us to provide a very diverse portfolio of projects and technologies to choose from to our people.
You will be part of a startup-minded branch of a company with a very strong and stable background of the Swissheadquarters.
Your contributions will have a distinct impact on our clients


We work with motivated people, who support and enrich each other. We live the possibilities of the digital world through home office, meaning you can work anywhere (within Switzerland) with flexible (annual) working hours. We also value face-to-face exchanges - coffee or tea, biscuits or fruit are all welcomed on board and shared throughout our offices.

If you ever feel the need to take a break from the digital world, we love to get hands-on together and use pens, paper, and whiteboards for brainstorming sessions. Need to clear your head? Hit the foosball table, PlayStation, massage bench or yoga mat. For networking and (brain) food, we offer regular exchange formats, like meetings, tech labs and more. Not enough? We are full believers in education and support training, whether it be internally or externally. We support you.

If you feel inspired by us, we'll probably be inspired by you. Join us now and apply online to make sure we match each other's expectations. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We welcome all qualified candidates - regardless of your gender or background. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Quantitative Analyst (Quant)
Description:
AudaCity Capital is a progressive and flourishing prop trading firm, and trading education provider. We are based in London, and at the moment have a team of highly trained properly trading professionals, managing the company’s extensive funds on our City of London based trading floor.We believe that the only way to be a winner in our industry is to invest heavily in talented people who want to grow with us. We are seeking like-minded professionals to develop their skills and enable them to join our team.We trade on all major asset classes on multiple exchanges with our own capital and do not handle any client funds or have customers. By becoming a member of the team, you become part of our success. We are market leaders because we have always had an internal vision to promote a strong entrepreneurial working culture.Our mission statement is to mix a strong base of intellectual capital with state-of-the-art technology, to build for the future. Our trading has a unique combination of skills, talent, and industry-leading software, which has been produced in-house by the company development department.Strict, Prudent Risk ManagementYou can have guts, but not glory, if you don’t back your trading moves with proper management practices. That’s why we treat risk management with the utmost seriousness …

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For


Developing scripts to process structured and unstructured data.
Recommending, developing and implementing ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.
Supporting translation of data business needs into technical system requirements.
Working with stakeholders to understand needs in order with respect to data structure, availability, scalability and accessibility.
Defining, developing and maintaining reports to support decision making.
Processing & Interpreting data to get actionable insights.
Working closely with business users to understand their data analysis needs/requirements.
Identifying trends, doing follow-up analysis, preparing visualizations.


Ideal Profile


You possess a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or related field.
You have at least 3 years experience, ideally within a Data Analyst or Data Engineer role.
Demonstrated experience working with large and complex data sets as well as experience analyzing volumes of data.
You have good presentation and communication skills and the ability to present you findings clearly and accessibly in the form of reports and presentations to senior colleagues.
You have working knowledge of exploratory data analysis
You pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard
You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments


What's on Offer?


Excellent career development opportunities
Work within a company with a solid track record of success
Leadership Role

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing and Digital Sales
Description:
Job Reference #
299146BR

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Do you have a passion for data and are excited about the opportunity to apply and further develop your know-how in dynamic and agile marketing organization? Do you have profound knowledge of databases (SQL)? Are you familiar with visualization tools and do you know how to prepare, provide, and analyze data to enable data-driven decisions?

We’re looking for a data analyst to:


build and establish the business and sales data foundation (e.g. data sources, data clean up, data warehouse)
develop concepts, validate data, execute analytics projects for marketing and digital sales to answer key strategic questions
analyze business needs and provide data-driven recommendations (timing, product push, journey) to increase conversion / MROI
enable and support the organization for data-driven decision-making and in the identification of growth opportunities
act as an internal account manager by developing close ties with internal key stakeholders and offering proactive support in the area of marketing and business intelligence
work on the interface of business, sales, marketing and market research data and connect different data sources for increased MROI
be the ambassador and enable the organization through education and lead the transformation (i.e., into the AI age)


Your team
You will be part of the Client Intelligence & Market Research team within Marketing and Digital Sales.

We deal with all client & market research activities for UBS Switzerland like exploration of client and sales data, measuring and continuous monitoring of client satisfaction as well as brand and marketing activities to identify improvement potentials within UBS Switzerland. You will work alongside a supportive team of experts who are passionate about leveraging data to identify growth opportunities and enhance client experiences.

Your expertise


Master’s degree in marketing and communication sciences or advanced studies in analytics
3+ years proven experience in a business intelligence role, including a track record in building BI architecture
expertise in data modeling, data warehouse design and data integration
proficiency in data visualization with Power BI
experience in SQL and Python (familiarity with frameworks/ tools like DBT, Pandas, etc. or willingness to learn)
strong business acumen with the ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions
can-do attitude and a very open and engaging personality with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g., Digital Marketing)
fluent in English and sound command of German


About Us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

How We Hire

We may request you to complete one or more assessments during the application process. Learn more

Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Title: Part-time: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Are you a student in Business Informatics, Industrial Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science looking for a side job that can boost your career while you study? Join our team at Matchspace Music, the premier destination for music teachers and learners, and assist our Chief Product Officer (CPO) in various data analytics and product management projects

Tasks


Your main project will be to implement a strategic and operative KPI framework for the startup. This involves:
Conceptualize a weekly, monthly and quarterly KPI dashboard for business operations excellence
Set up the (automated) connectors from different data sources in order to collect the necessary data in a data platform
Transform, calculate and prepare the data as necessary (ETL pipelines)
Visualize and analyze weekly, monthly and quarterly business reports in BI solution to help guide our business decisions
In addition, you will support our CPO in various product management and digital marketing topics:
Analyze website statistics and user feedback to inform product decision-making.
Draft processes in the customer journey and design UI mockups on wireframing and whiteboarding tools
Define product requirements and write detailed user stories.
QA Test developed features and guide web developers in the implementation of product features.
Analyze SEO, SEM and other performance marketing metrics to optimize our reach and impact.
Support in diverse project management activities.



Requirements


Currently enrolled in a university program in Business Informatics, Data Science, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or Business Administration - or looking for a job on the side (10-20%)
Reliable, results-oriented personality
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Basic understanding of product management, web development and UI/UX principles.
Familiarity with SEO and performance marketing is a plus.
Fluent communication skills in English. German is a plus



Benefits


The fulfillment of working for a mission-driven company making music education accessibly to everyone
The experience of being part of a dynamic and innovative working environment in an music edtech Swiss startup, supported by the Swiss Federation innovation agency
Flexible working hours to fit your study schedule
Opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a technology-driven startup, focusing on diverse, critical subjects in business controlling, product management, digital marketing and project management
A chance to become a future full-time team member of a fast-growing company making a real impact in music education



If you are passionate about technology and music education, we want to hear from you!

At Matchspace Music, we make music education accessible to everyone, empowering teachers to earn more and students to enjoy flexible, personalized learning experiences. Join us in revolutionizing the music education market with our all-in-one platform that connects students and teachers like never before.
